page.title: 11CORBY LINKS WITH GERMANY.
page.content: Being one of the few British schools offering German as a first foreign language, we interviewed 167 parents of 1st year pupils and found that: 46% had studied a foreign language at school, usually French, 3% had studied German, only 14% couldn't remember any of it! Although most thought their study had been of no practical use, 99% wanted their children to learn one "because it might be useful in later life". 84% preferred German, but only 21% had been to Germany. 10 pupils from our twin-town of Velbert, after visiting Corby, said they liked our large school building, semi- detached houses, friendly shop assistants, pedestrian precincts and cheap taxis. They disliked monotonous housing, the scarcity of trees, unemployed people and Corby's small swimming pool!
